author: Michael O'Boyle
description: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.
title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he was visiting the White House to discuss important matters impacting his constituents, but President Donald Trump after their meeting said the two discussed “almost nothing.”
title: Trump Says NYC’s Adams Came to White House to ‘Thank Me’

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said that he would “always” impose a minimum 10% tariff on trading partners — before quickly adding that “there could be an exception,” underscoring the difficulty discerning the US approach to dozens of trade deals under negotiation.
title: Trump Says 10% Tariff Baseline Unless ‘Exceptional’ Offer Made

author: Akayla Gardner
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Heading to Middle East Seeking Investments in US

author: Carolina Millan, Maya Averbuch, Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s finance chief Edgar Amador said the North American free trade agreement should continue to bolster the economy despite the threat that the US could push for major changes to it.
title: Mexico Finance Chief Says USMCA-Protected Exports Bolster Growth

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Trump administration officials are crafting executive orders to expedite the approval and construction of nuclear power plants across the US, a bid to meet surging electricity demand.
title: Trump Team Weighs Expediting Nuclear Power Plant Construction

author: Ryan Beene, Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration is probing whether imported aircraft, jet engines and parts represent a threat to national security, a precursor to imposing new tariffs targeting the commercial aerospace industry.
title: Trump Opens Door to Tariffs on Commercial Aircraft, Engines

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The White House is “actively looking at” whether to suspend the ability of migrants to challenge their detention in court as part of an effort to speed its deportation efforts, senior adviser Stephen Miller said Friday.
title: Trump Weighs Suspending Migrants’ Ability to Challenge Detention

author: Sri Taylor, David Voreacos, Dylan Sloan
description: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, was arrested Friday as he protested at a controversial private detention facility that is expected to play a key role in President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportation of immigrants.
title: Newark Mayor Baraka Arrested Outside ICE Detention Center

author: Sophie Alexander, Bill Allison
description: Former Palantir Technologies Inc. adviser Jacob Helberg plans to retain investments in dozens of artificial intelligence, defense and fintech companies as he starts his tenure as an under secretary of state in Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Ex-Palantir Adviser to Keep SpaceX, OpenAI Stakes in Trump Role

author: Kamran Haider, Ruchi Bhatia
description: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board on Friday approved a roughly $1 billion loan disbursements to Pakistan, bringing some relief for the nation’s fragile finances amid its worsening conflict with neighboring India.
title: IMF Approves $1 Billion Pakistan Payment Over India’s Objection

author: Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign a trio of new executive actions on Friday designed to reduce the impact of regulations, part of an effort the White House has said will inspire economic growth.
title: Trump Plans Trio of Executive Actions Targeting Regulations

author: Josh Wingrove, Alicia Diaz
description: The Trump administration’s first trade talks involve an eclectic mix of major exporters and smaller economies, as the White House looks to rack up agreements that could serve as models for other negotiations.
title: Trump’s Priority List for Tariff Talks Homes In on Around 20 Economies

author: Ania Nussbaum, Daryna Krasnolutska, Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham
description: Senior European officials are in talks with the Trump administration to finalize an agreement on a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine that would impose new sanctions on Russia if President Vladimir Putin doesn’t budge, said people familiar with the matter.
title: Europe in Talks With US Over Ultimatum to End War in Ukraine

author: Erik Larson
description: A federal judge granted a request by a Turkish graduate student to be released on bail while she fights possible deportation, ruling that her continued detainment “chills the speech” of noncitizens.
title: Tufts Grad Student Öztürk Released on Bail in Setback for Trump

author: Daniel Flatley
description: President Donald Trump plans to nominate attorney Jonathan McKernan as the Treasury Department’s head of domestic finance, Secretary Scott Bessent announced in a statement Friday.
title: Trump to Nominate McKernan for Domestic Finance Role at Treasury

author: Nancy Cook, Erik Wasson
description: House Republicans are considering increasing taxes on university endowments, a significant threat to some of the nation’s wealthiest schools as President Donald Trump seeks to tighten control over American higher education.
title: GOP Eyes Tax Hike on Endowments in Escalation of Ivy League Feud

author: James Mayger, Katia Dmitrieva
description: The future of one of the world’s biggest trading relationships hangs in the balance after US President Donald Trump escalated the tariff war with China by imposing steep duties on imports from the country.
title: What to Know About the US-China Trade War as Talks Begin

author: Steven Church, Jonathan Randles
description: A federal contractor that filed bankruptcy earlier this week during the latest round of government cutbacks asked a judge to approve a quick auction because of the ongoing threat of Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.
title: Bankrupt Federal Contractor Seeks Fast Sale to Avoid DOGE Threat

author: Gregory Korte, Ari Natter
description: President Donald Trump has fired Richard Trumka Jr. from the Consumer Product Safety Commission, a week after the Democratic commissioner voted to defy an executive order that asserted the White House’s power over independent regulatory agencies.
title: Trump Fires Consumer Watchdog Who Defied Executive Order

author: Golnar Motevalli
description: The fourth round of indirect talks between Iran and the US over the Islamic Republic’s nuclear program will take place on Sunday in the Omani capital Muscat, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said.
title: Iran Says Next Round of US Nuclear Talks Scheduled for Sunday

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Columbia University has suspended more than 65 students on an interim basis pending investigation and barred 33 individuals from campus after dozens of pro-Palestine protesters stormed the school’s main library during finals week.
title: Columbia Suspends Over 65 Students After Takeover of Library

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s foreign minister, Espen Barth Eide, said Israel’s plan to forcibly move the population in Gaza to the south of the enclave would be a “gross violation of international law.”
title: Norway Minister Says Israel’s Plan to Displace Gazans Is Illegal

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa’s government is engaging US authorities about the Trump administration’s plan to resettle White Afrikaners to ensure the program doesn’t provide an opportunity for fugitives to flee.
title: South Africa in Talks on US’s White-Afrikaner Resettlement Plan

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Hugo Miller
description: Switzerland held what it said were “constructive” trade talks with US officials Friday and hopes to soon follow the UK and sign a deal with Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Swiss Hold Constructive US Trade Talks, Hope to Follow UK Deal

author: Myles Miller
description: The US Justice Department’s top civil rights official said the division is considering making gun rights a formal priority, in a significant shift from its traditional focus.
title: Trump’s DOJ Weighs Gun Rights as a Focus for Civil Rights Division

author: Olga Kharif
description: Democratic senators including Maryland’s Chris Van Hollen and Massachusetts’ Elizabeth Warren are demanding answers from top federal officials about ties between crypto giant Binance and Trump family-related digital asset ventures.
title: Treasury, DOJ Pressed by Senators About Binance Ties to Trump

author: Billy House
description: Representative Nicole Malliotakis said increasing the state and local tax deduction cap to $30,000 from $10,000 would reduce the tax burden of the vast majority of people in her district, indicating support for a proposal that is dividing Republicans.
title: Staten Island’s Malliotakis Signals Support for $30,000 SALT Cap

author: Joe Mayes
description: The United States’s offer to cut steel tariffs on the United Kingdom will only come into effect once the UK has met requirements relating to the ownership of certain plants, a condition that raises further doubts about the Chinese firm Jingye Group’s possession of British Steel.
title: Trump’s UK Steel Deal Could Target Chinese Ownership of Plants

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India and Pakistan continued to trade accusations about military action against each other as hostilities entered a third day, with no sign of easing tensions.
title: India, Pakistan Trade Accusations as Hostilities Enter Third Day

author: Simon Marks
description: A long-simmering dispute between Sudan’s army and a paramilitary group exploded into a full-blown civil war in April 2023. At least 150,000 people may have been killed since then, according to US estimates, and the violence shows little sign of abating.
title: Sudan Is Being Ravaged by a Civil War the World Has Overlooked

author: Alastair Gale, Swati Pandey, Rebecca Choong Wilkins
description: For global leaders puzzling over how to negotiate with Donald Trump, the US president’s inaugural pact with the UK offers a few clues on how much ground he’s prepared to give.
title: Trump’s First Trade Pact Offers Faint Glimpse on Art of the Deal

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he would be fine with Republican lawmakers raising taxes on the wealthy, but acknowledged the political challenges of doing so for the party as he prepares to meet with the head of the House tax committee on Friday.
title: Trump Cautions GOP on Tax Hike for Rich, But He’s ‘OK’ With It

author: Dylan Sloan, Michael Smith
description: Not far from Ellis Island, “Golden Door” for 12 million immigrants, things are looking up for a growth industry in today’s America: prisons.
title: Trump’s Deportation Campaign Fuels Prison Founder’s $304 Million Fortune

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump floated an 80% tariff on China ahead of negotiations due to begin Saturday as he urged Beijing to do more to open their markets to US goods.
title: Trump Says 80% China Tariff ‘Seems Right,’ Ahead of Talks

author: Tom Rees, Philip Aldrick
description: The leader of Britain’s national statistics agency has stepped down amid a crisis of confidence in the country’s official economic data.
title: UK Stats Chief Steps Down Amid Mistrust in Key Economic Data

author: Sanjai P R
description: India’s cricket governing body has suspended cricket matches in the ongoing Indian Premier League, or IPL, for at least a  week, amid a rapid escalation in armed conflict with neighboring Pakistan.
title: India Cricket Body Stops IPL Games for a Week Amid Border Strife

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Major tech companies lobbying to salvage a tax deduction for research and development are warning they may pull back from high-profile pledges of new US investments if Congress doesn’t fully reinstate the break.
title: Tech Industry Warns US Investment Pledges Hinge on Research Tax Break

author: Eric Martin
description: The escape of five members of Venezuela’s opposition took President Nicolas Maduro’s government by surprise, the Trump administration’s outgoing Latin America envoy said, rebutting the regime’s claims that the departure had been negotiated.
title: Trump Envoy Says Venezuela Escape Exposes Maduro’s Vulnerability

author: Nguyen Xuan Quynh
description: Vietnam’s trade ministry called the Trump administration’s so-called reciprocal tariff “unreasonable” as trade talks between Washington and Hanoi begin.
title: Vietnam Calls Trump Tariff ‘Unreasonable’ as Trade Talks Start

author: Michal Kubala
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said she could envision a visit to Washington to meet President Donald Trump to discuss trade negotiations once a concrete trade package is on the table.
title: EU’s Von der Leyen Says Concrete Trade Deal Would Merit US Visit

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli is set to compete with Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s daughter for their party’s deputy presidency, a development that’s set to heighten tensions in the country’s ruling bloc.
title: Malaysia’s Rafizi to Face Off Anwar’s Daughter in Party Polls

author: Martin Ritchie, Colum Murphy
description: China has been ignoring the European Union’s concerns over trade issues for the past two decades, the bloc’s top envoy said, underscoring the challenges Beijing faces in its campaign to warm ties between the two sides.
title: China Not Taking EU ‘Seriously’ on Trade Issues, Envoy Says

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Enter a US-Born Pope to Wield Vatican’s Power

author: Mark Niquette
description: US President Donald Trump says his tariffs will spark a “manufacturing renaissance.” But the duties themselves are making that already monumental task even more challenging.
title: Trump’s ‘Manufacturing Renaissance’ Is Even Harder With Tariffs

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Pope Leo XIV celebrates his first mass as pontiff Friday after his historic appointment as the first American to lead the world’s 1.4 billion Roman Catholics.
title: First American Pope Brings Social Justice Mission to Torn World

author: Michael Nienaber, Christoph Rauwald
description: Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, said he told US President Donald Trump that he can negotiate trade matters only with the European Union and there can’t be any side deals with individual member states.
title: Merz Tells Trump He Can’t Do Side Deals With EU Nations on Trade

author: William Horobin
description: Germany and France’s finances chiefs vowed to drive a new phase in European policy making as they met for the first time in Paris after the confirmation of Friedrich Merz as German chancellor this week.
title: French and German Finance Chiefs Eye New Phase for EU Policy

author: Andrew Rosati
description: The economy of Governador Valadares runs on sending migrants to the US, legally or not. Now it’s bracing for a grim homecoming.
title: Trump’s Deportations Upend a Town at Epicenter of Brazilian Migration

author: Andrew Rosati
description: La economía de Governador Valadares se basa en enviar migrantes a EE.UU., ya sea de forma legal o ilegal. Ahora se prepara para un sombrío regreso a casa
title: Deportaciones de Trump ponen en jaque a una ciudad brasileña que vive de enviar migrantes

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine detained two people who allegedly spied for Hungary, a development that’s likely to exacerbate tensions between the neighbors.
title: Ukraine Detains Alleged Hungarian Spies in New Blow to Ties

author: Shruti Srivastava, Pratik Parija
description: India is analyzing a US request to ease restrictions around the purchase of genetically modified crops as part of ongoing trade negotiations between the two countries, people aware of the matter said.
title: India Reviews US Demands for Lower Curbs on GM Crop Imports

author: Natalia Ojewska, Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk said a treaty he is set to sign with President Emmanuel Macron on Friday will open the way toward potentially sharing the protection from French nuclear missiles.
title: Poland to Open Way for French Nuclear Shield Talks With a Treaty

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin said Russia would achieve its strategic goals in Ukraine as he insisted the country was united behind his war.
title: Putin Says Russia to Win Ukraine ‘Victory’ as Trump Seeks Truce

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Lost banknotes from the 1970s are set to give Switzerland a windfall.
title: Swiss Lost Cash Racks Up $1.1 Billion Windfall for Government

author: Arne Delfs, Michael Nienaber
description: Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, and US President Donald Trump agreed trade disputes should be resolved quickly and discussed the need for close cooperation between the two nations.
title: Germany Says Trump and Merz Agree on Need for Swift Trade Accord

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping said he hopes to see a “fair” peace deal on Ukraine, the latest move in his balancing act to mend ties with Europe in the face of a de facto trade embargo from the US.
title: Xi Tells Putin to Reach ‘Fair’ Peace Deal to End War on Ukraine

author: Matthew Brooker
description: If the campaign against abolition of the “non-dom” regime is measured by the volume of noise on each side, then the verdict is already in.
title: The Ultra-Rich Move in Herds. Just Ask London.

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: He was known just as Bob, a White Sox fan from the South Side of Chicago. Now a mild-mannered cardinal with a minimal social media footprint has become the first American pope in history.
title: How White Sox Fan ‘Bob’ Beat the Odds to Become First US Pope

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: North Korea’s latest short-range missile tests aimed to simulate nuclear attacks on the US and South Korea, Pyongyang’s state media said Friday.
title: North Korea Says Missile Tests Aimed to Simulate Nuclear Strikes

author: Shawn Donnan
description: The Trump administration is weighing a dramatic tariff reduction during weekend talks with China to de-escalate tensions and temper the economic pain both are already starting to feel.
title: Trump Team Seeks Tariff Cuts, Rare Earths Relief in China Talks

author: Justin Sink
description: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that trade deals with South Korea and Japan could take significantly more time to complete than the framework agreement President Donald Trump announced Thursday with the UK, in a signal that some Asian partners may have to wait for tariff relief.
title: Lutnick Warns South Korea, Japan Deals More Complicated Than UK
